Key Match Events: Tigers' bats were quieted by rookie right-hander Jack Kochanowicz, who struck out three of the first 10 Tigers he faced and finished with four through his six shutout innings, getting eight ground ball outs.
Tigers stranded runners at the corners in the seventh and then loaded the bases with two outs in the eighth.
Ben Joyce closed out the game with a well-located, 95-mph sinker to Spencer Torkelson, punching him out.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers manager AJ Hinch emphasized focusing on the current game rather than future possibilities.
Hinch stated that the Tigers' bats had opportunities but couldn't deliver the big hit.
Manager Hinch commented on Keider Montero's struggles, noting that he was under stress in every inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers' manager AJ Hinch emphasized that the team needs to win each game individually and not get caught up in standings.
Tigers fell five games behind the Twins, who hold the final wild card spot by three games over the Red Sox, Mariners, and Tigers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lefty Joey Wentz was hit on the palm of his left hand with a 95-mph comebacker and then hit again on the right knee by Taylor Ward, causing him to stay down for several minutes and later leave the game due to pain.
